subject: Philosophy
title: Mill's Refinement
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mill's Refinement usable.

hook.text: Is a game of checkers as valuable as reading Shakespeare? Bentham said yes. Mill said absolutely not.

buildup.text: John Stuart Mill argued that pleasures differ in quality, not just quantity.

discovery.text: Higher pleasures â€” intellect, art, deep relationships â€” outweigh lower ones like simple amusement.

twist.text: Critics asked: who decides which pleasures are higher? That sounds like elitism in disguise.

climax.text: Mill replied: anyone who has experienced both will prefer the higher. The test is experience itself.

punchline.text: Better to be Socrates unhappy than a fool satisfied.

quiz.question: How did Mill differ from Bentham on pleasure?
options: Mill said some pleasures are qualitatively superior
Mill said all pleasures are equal
